children.name: have the same opinion as sb else
agree
children.definition: to have the same opinion:
examples: ▪ I think it’s too expensive. Do you agree?
▪ ‘Yes, I’m sure you’re right,’ agreed Tony.
agree with
▪ Mr Johnson thinks it’s too risky, and I tend to agree with him.
▪ Lee agreed with Jackson that more opportunities should be created for minorities in film .
agree that
▪ Most experts agree that drugs like heroin can cause permanent brain damage.
agree on/about
▪ I agree with you about the color -- it looks awful.
▪ The one thing all the parties agreed on was the need for fair elections.
I quite agreeBritish I agree completely
▪ Yes, I quite agree. Why should poor people pay so much tax?
I couldn’t agree moreI agree completely
▪ ‘I wish it was time to go home.’ ‘I couldn’t agree more.’

children.name: be in agreement
children.definition: if people are in agreement, they have the same opinion about something, especially after discussing it a lot and trying to agree:
examples: ▪ No decision can be made until everyone is in agreement.

children.name: be in agreement on
examples: ▪ The two sides are in agreement on the need for arms reduction.

children.name: be in agreement with
examples: ▪ I found myself in agreement with the lawyer, for once.

children.name: be of the same opinion
children.definition: to have the same opinion as sb on a particular subject:
examples: Both teachers were of the same opinion - she should be expelled from school immediately.
Mrs Ford clearly disapproved, and her sister appeared to be of the same opinion.

children.name: share the view that
children.definition: to have the same opinion as someone, especially about something important, in politics, business, science etc: đồng ý với quan điểm rằng
examples: ▪ I share the view that peace can only be achieved through dialogue.

children.name: share sb’s view
examples: ▪ Many people shared Duvald’s view, and thought the plan should be stopped.

children.name: share this/that view
examples: ▪ This view is shared by many doctors.

children.name: subscribe to
children.definition: to have the same opinion or belief as a lot of other people: tán thành
examples: ▪ She has always subscribed to the view that children should be given responsibility from an early age.
▪ There is a business philosophy I subscribe to, which says that if you are not making mistakes, you are not doing it right.

children.name: concur
children.definition: to say that you have the same opinion as someone else: đồng tình

children.name: ▪ ‘My opinion exactly’, he concurred.concur with
examples: ▪ He resigned three years later, because he did not concur with the division of the country into separate republics.

children.name: to finish making a business plan or agreement
settle
children.definition: kí kết, hoàn tất
examples: ▪ In the end we settled the deal on very favorable terms.
▪ So that settles it. We’ll pay you half the purchase price now, and the rest over two years.
▪ We talked to the carpenter to settle plans for the expansion of the restaurant.

children.name: conclude
children.definition: conclude a deal/treaty/agreementsuccessfully finish an agreement, especially one that is important and involves a large number of people:
examples: conclusion/kənˈkluːʒən/ [uncountable noun]
▪ The future of the prisoners will be decided on the conclusion of the armistice when the armistice is concluded.

children.name: kí kết
examples: ▪ The British car industry has just concluded a deal with the Japanese government.
▪ European governments are trying to conclude a treaty to ban certain atmospheric tests.

children.name: wrap up
children.definition: to finish a meeting, a business agreement, or a plan by settling everything quickly in a satisfactory way:
examples: hoàn tất , hoàn thành
wrap up something
▪ If they accept our price we can wrap up the deal right away.
wrap something/it/them up
▪ I want to wrap this meeting up as quickly as possible. I have another appointment in an hour.

children.name: sew up
children.definition: to settle a business agreement or plan in a satisfactory way, especially in a way that is favourable to you:

children.name: sew something/it/them up
examples: ▪ I called the real estate agent. The contract’s been sewn up, and we can move into the apartment next week.

children.name: sew something up
examples: ▪ Bob reckons he can sew up the deal quite quickly but I’m not so sure.

children.name: finalize
children.definition: /finaliseUK  to do the last things that are necessary in order to settle an agreement, plan, or arrangement in a satisfactory way: hoàn tất, hoàn thành
examples: Mr Samuels is flying to Detroit to finalize the details and sign the contract.
Don’t proceed any further with any plans or finalize any arrangements until you have proper authority.

children.name: close a deal
children.definition: to finish making a business agreement, especially where a large amount of money is involved: kết thúc thỏa thuận
examples: The oil company has just succeeded in closing a deal for th

children.name: agree to sb else's plan or suggestion
agree
children.definition: to say yes to someone else’s plan or suggestion:
examples: ▪ Charles suggested going for a picnic, and we all agreed.
▪ The project can’t go ahead until the finance committee agrees.

children.name: agree to
examples: ▪ The Council of Ministers would never agree to such a plan.
▪ Few people expect the rebels to agree to the peace plan.

children.name: agree wholeheartedlyagree completely and very willingly
examples: ▪ When I proposed that in future we should hold our meetings in the bar, the others agreed wholeheartedly.

children.name: go along with
children.definition: to agree with someone else’s plan or suggestion, even if you are not sure if it is the right thing to do:
examples: ▪ We went along with Eva’s idea, since no one could think of a better one.
▪ Usually it was easier just to go along with him, rather than risk an argument.
▪ The bank decided to go along with our proposal and lent us the two million pounds we needed.

children.name: fall in with
children.definition: British to accept someone’s plan or suggestion and do what they want you to do:

children.name: tán thành, đồng tình
examples: ▪ She expects her friends to fall in with everything she wants to do.
▪ He was irritated by her refusal to fall in with his plans.

children.name: go with
children.definition: American to accept someone’s plan or suggestion:
examples: We considered all the options and decided to go with John’s original proposal.

children.name: agreement
children.definition: an arrangement that is made when two or more people, countries, or organizations agree to do something: thảo thuận, hợp đồng
examples: ▪ Eventually all the parties signed the agreement.

children.name: agreement on
examples: ▪ Congress could not come up with an agreement on a spending plan for next year.

children.name: make an agreement
examples: ▪ They made a secret agreement not to tell anyone about their plans.

children.name: have an agreement that
examples: ▪ I thought we had an agreement that you would keep me informed about any changes in the programme.

children.name: under an agreement
examples: ▪ Under the Geneva agreement, a French force was supposed to remain in South Vietnam until July 1956.

children.name: understanding
children.definition: an informal agreement between two people or organizations that is not written down: thỏa thuận sơ bộ, không chính thức

children.name: have an understanding
examples: ▪ Adams and the police have an understanding -- he gives them information and they don’t ask any questions about his activities.

children.name: come to an understanding (that)agree after a discussion
examples: ▪ We came to an understanding that I would find a job and my husband would stay home with the baby.

children.name: understanding between
examples: ▪ It was an unspoken understanding between Stu and me that I was going to be a lawyer and he was going to be an engineer.

children.name: compromise
children.definition: an agreement in which both people or groups accept less than they really want: thỏa hiệp, dàn xếp
examples: reach/find a compromise
▪ After several hours of discussions, they managed to reach a compromise.compromise between
▪ Officials hope to find a compromise between Britain and other EU members.

children.name: pact
children.definition: a written agreement between two or more countries or political parties in which they promise to support each other or defend each other: hiệp ước, công ước ( ủng hộ bảo vệ nhau )
examples: ▪ Officials at IBM and Apple declined to comment on a possible pact between the two personal computer makers.
▪ Mexico’s Defense Ministry this month signed a pact that allows Mexican troops to train at American bases.

children.name: contract
children.definition: a written legal agreement with all the details of a job or business arrangement, for example what someone must do and how much they will be paid: hợp đồng
examples: ▪ My contract says I have to work 35 hours per week.

children.name: sign a contract (with somebody) : kí một hợp đồng với ai
examples: ▪ Baltimore officials have confirmed that Olson will sign a two-year contract with the club.

children.name: break a contractto break the rules of a contract : phá vỡ hợp đồng
examples: ▪ The company was prosecuted for breaking the contract.

children.name: when everyone agree on a decision, plan, etc
agree
children.definition: if two or more people agree, they reach a decision about what to do, and they are all satisfied with it:
examples: ▪ Ultimately the two sides could not agree, and negotiations were abandoned.

children.name: agree on
examples: ▪ We’ve finally agreed on a date for the party.

children.name: agree to do sth
examples: ▪ They agreed to meet up later in the week.

children.name: agree that
examples: ▪ Finally, after some tough negotiating, it was agreed that the workforce would be reduced by 10%.

children.name: agree a price/plan/strategy etc
examples: ▪ After a few minutes’ discussion we had agreed a price and the car was mine.

children.name: the agreed price/date/figure etc
examples: ▪ We refused to pay because the goods were not delivered by the agreed date.

children.name: it is agreeda group of people have agreed about something
examples: ▪ It was agreed that the price should be fixed at $200.

children.name: we are (all) agreedsay this when everyone in a group has agreed about something
examples: ▪ Right then, are we all agreed?

children.name: reach agreement
children.definition: /come to an agreement to finally agree on sth, by discussing it until everyone is satisfied with the decision: đi đến thỏa thuận
examples: After two years of talks, the Russians and the Americans finally reached an agreement.

children.name: reach agreement/ come to an agreement with
examples: We are determined to reach agreement with the IMF before the end of the year.
Danvers had come to a private agreement with the owners of the land which secured his right to purchase it.

children.name: reach agreement/ come to an agreement on
examples: After a week of talks, Britain and Iceland reached agreement on fishing limits.

children.name: come to some agreement find a way to agree
examples: If you can’t pay all the money now, I’m sure we can come to some agreement.

children.name: make a deal
children.definition: alsodo a dealBritish /cut a dealAmerican   to make an agreement with someone so that you get what you want, and they get what they want: thỏa thuận
examples: ▪ If he’s willing to argue about the price, then he must want to do a deal.

children.name: make a deal with
examples: ▪ The government denied making a deal with the kidnappers.

children.name: ▪ He looked at me suspiciously. ‘Have you made a deal with them?’
examples: ▪ The administration is showing a willingness to cut a deal with Congress on gun-control legislation.

children.name: make a bargain
children.definition: strike/  to agree to do something for someone else if they will do something for you: thỏa thuận
examples: ▪ Let’s make a bargain. I’ll tell you what you want to know provided you don’t breathe a word of it to anyone else
strike/make a bargain with
▪ Eventually she struck a bargain with him. She would get him a job if he would help her with her singing.
strike/make a bargain that
▪ They made a bargain that they would stick together no matter what.

children.name: when people have the same opinion about sth
agreement
children.definition: a situation in which two or more people, groups etc have the same opinion about something: sự đồng ý

children.name: agreement that
examples: ▪ There is general agreement among doctors that pregnant women should not smoke.

children.name: agreement on
examples: ▪ Officials said there was widespread agreement on the need to promote growth by cutting government spending.

children.name: in agreement
examples: ▪ Tara nodded her head in agreement.

children.name: consensus
children.definition: general agreement among most of the people in a group, especially an official group that makes important decisions: sự nhất trí chung
examples: Events in Eastern Europe shifted popular consensus against a new generation of nuclear weapons.
consensus on/about
a lack of consensus about the aims of the project
consensus that
There is a consensus among teachers that children should have a broad understanding of the world.
theconsensus politicsof the fifties
consent[ I ] C1 to agree to do something, or to allow someone to do something :đồng ý; ưng thuận
My aunt never married because her father wouldn't consenttoher marriage.

children.name: reach a consensus
children.definition: alsoarrive at a consensus
examples: The committee found that it was unable to reach a consensus.

children.name: achieve a consensus
examples: Will further talks achieve a consensus on the UN peace plan?

children.name: build a consensus
children.definition: gradually achieve a consensus
examples: Canada worked on building a consensus among national governments.

children.name: a consensus emerges
children.definition: is reached after talking about something
examples: No consensus emerged from these discussions.

children.name: national/international consensus
examples: There was no international consensus on how to deal with the situation.

children.name: political/scientific etc consensus
examples: The scientific consensus is that global warming is already occurring.

children.name: general consensus
examples: Most decisions are reached by general consensus.

children.name: broad consensus
children.definition: general
examples: There is a broad consensus that sport is good for you.

children.name: clear consensus
children.definition: one that people agree on and understand
examples: There was no clear consensus about the future direction of the company.

children.name: growing consensus
children.definition: one that more people are agreeing on
examples: The growing consensus is that we should focus on economic efficiency.

children.name: strong consensus
examples: There is a strong consensus that it is time for a change of leadership.

children.name: a consensus of opinion
examples: There are still areas where no consensus of opinion has been reached.

children.name: a lack of consensus
examples: Nothing was done because of a lack of consensus on the matter.

children.name: [ + to infinitive ]
examples: Very reluctantly, I've consentedtolend her my car.

children.name: unanimous
children.definition: if a group of people is unanimous, they all have the same opinion about something, especially about what should be done or who should be chosen or elected: nhất trí
examples: ▪ The decision of the committee was unanimous.unanimous agreement/choice/decision/vote etc
▪ Mr Harada was elected by a unanimous vote.
▪ Ryan needed unanimous agreement to bring his proposal up for a vote.
unanimously[adverb]
▪ The union members voted unanimously for a
